Class AuthManager

java.lang.Object
cat.dam.roig.cleanstream.services.auth.AuthManager
public class AuthManager extends Object
Manages authentication, session token persistence and "Remember me" behavior.

This service is responsible for:

  • Performing login using MediaPolling.login(String, String)
  • Storing and retrieving a JWT token and remembered email using Preferences
  • Trying auto-login by validating the stored token against the backend
  • Clearing auth state on logout, optionally keeping the remembered email
  • Notifying the application when login succeeds via a callback

Important notes:

  • This class coordinates UI feedback (dialogs) because it reads credentials from LoginPanel. In a stricter architecture, UI feedback would be moved to a controller.
  • The token validity depends on the backend. If validation fails, stored data is cleared.
  • Passwords are handled as char[] and wiped after use to reduce exposure in memory.
Author:
metku

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthManager

      public AuthManager(MediaPolling comp)
      Creates an AuthManager that will authenticate through the provided MediaPolling component.
      Parameters:
      comp - MediaPolling instance used to call backend endpoints (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if comp is null

  • Method Details

    • setLoginPanel

      public void setLoginPanel(LoginPanel loginPanel)
      Injects the LoginPanel dependency.

      AuthManager reads the credentials from this panel and updates UI fields when clearing state or keeping the email.

      Parameters:
      loginPanel - login UI panel (can be null if auth is used without UI)

    • setOnLoginSuccess

      public void setOnLoginSuccess(Runnable onLoginSuccess)
      Sets the callback that will be executed when login succeeds.
      Parameters:
      onLoginSuccess - callback to run after a successful login

    • saveToken

      public void saveToken(String token)
      Stores a JWT token in preferences.
      Parameters:
      token - JWT token. If null or blank, nothing is stored.

    • getStoredToken

      public String getStoredToken()
      Retrieves the stored JWT token.
      Returns:
      stored token, or null if not found

    • clearToken

      public void clearToken()
      Removes any stored token from preferences.

    • saveRememberMe

      public void saveRememberMe(String email, String token)
      Stores remember-me data: email and token.

      Email is used to pre-fill the login form. Token is used for auto-login.

      Parameters:
      email - user's email to remember
      token - token to store for auto-login

    • getRememberedEmail

      public String getRememberedEmail()
      Returns:
      the remembered email, or empty string if not stored

    • isRememberEnabled

      public boolean isRememberEnabled()
      Indicates whether remember-me is enabled for this machine.
      Returns:
      true if remember-me is enabled; false otherwise

    • clearRememberMe

      public void clearRememberMe()
      Clears all remember-me data: email and token.

      Also clears the token in MediaPolling and resets UI fields if loginPanel is available.

    • logoutButKeepEmail

      public void logoutButKeepEmail()
      Logs out but keeps the remembered email.

      This method:

      • Clears token from preferences
      • Clears token from MediaPolling
      • Restores remembered email in the UI, clears password field

    • tryAutoLogin

      public boolean tryAutoLogin()
      Attempts to auto-login using the stored token (if present).

      Flow:

      1. Reads token from preferences
      2. Sets token into MediaPolling
      3. Validates token with a minimal backend call
      4. If invalid: clears stored auth state and returns false
      Returns:
      true if stored token exists and is valid; false otherwise

    • doLogin

      public void doLogin()
      Performs a login using the credentials currently entered in LoginPanel.

      Behavior:

      • Validates non-empty email and password
      • Calls backend login to obtain a token
      • Stores or clears remember-me data depending on checkbox selection
      • Calls onLoginSuccess if login succeeds
      • Shows user feedback via JOptionPane on validation or login failure

      Security: Password is read as char[] and wiped in finally.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if loginPanel has not been injected

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user, clearing the token from both preferences and MediaPolling.

      Also resets UI state (if loginPanel is present). Depending on remember-me behavior, callers may prefer using logoutButKeepEmail() or clearRememberMe().
